snippet.title: NSA's reported Huawei hack gives glimpse of agency's role in 'cyber Cold War'
snippet.description: The latest report based on leaks by Edward Snowden has it that the NSA hacked into the servers of a Chinese router company that had itself been accused by the US of potentially aiding government espionage.

snippet.title: Wanna tweet to aliens? Cold War dish to target deep space
snippet.description: Lone Signal is a crowdsourcing project to send signals to hypothetical aliens who live around a star that's 17 light-years away. What could go wrong?

snippet.title: Battlefield 4 (PlayStation 3)
snippet.description: Battlefield 4's campaign is an emotional ride packed with an impressive amount of graphical prowess. If you have the right hardware, Battlefield 4 will dazzle you with jaw-dropping detail and production value.

snippet.title: Gears of War: Judgment (Xbox 360)
snippet.description: In Gears of War: Judgment, a few new gameplay mechanics and some fresh faces add some longevity to a series that has just about run out of gas on Xbox 360.

snippet.title: God of War: Ascension (PlayStation 3)
snippet.description: God of War: Ascension doesn't break any barriers, but it's still a top-of-the-line action game that will most likely please veteran fans of the series.

snippet.title: B-2s, B-52s, and the plane that ended World War II
snippet.description: Visitors to the National Museum of the U.S. Air Force in Dayton, Ohio, can come face to face with the best collection of military aircraft in the world. CNET Road Trip 2013 checked it out.

snippet.title: U.N. summit's meltdown ignites new Internet Cold War
snippet.description: New geopolitical rift isn't east-west or north-south: it roughly tracks commitment to free expression. The U.S., Canada, Europe, Japan, and their allies are now facing off against the likes of China, Russia, Libya, Nigeria, and dozens of other nations.

snippet.title: Cold War secrets: Spy satellite photos lost at sea, then saved
snippet.description: Photos newly released by the CIA show how the Navy pulled off one of the deepest undersea salvage efforts ever and retrieved spy images of Soviet sub bases and missile silos.

snippet.title: Ep. 1523: Global cyber cold war imminent?
snippet.description: On today's show, security researchers report that Anonymous and LulzSec are, if anything, just distracting us with their antics while the true threat is a years-long cyberwarfare campaign that's stolen everything from private intellectual property to high-level government secrets. So, that'll probably lead to some reasoned and logical cyber-security discussions, no? No. Also, is the Amazon App Store screwing developers, and are you finally getting what you pay for, broadband-wise?

snippet.title: Facebook's Hot Mom enjoys more cold stares
snippet.description: Maria Kang likes to post pictures of herself looking fit, strong, and gorgeous. This has tended to upset people who aren't. A new photo causes fresh upset
